subject: Critical Thinking
subcategory: Evidence & Truth: How We Know What's Real
title: Observational Studies: When Experiments Are Impossible
description: A micro-lesson that makes Observational Studies: When Experiments Are Impossible usable.

hook.text: You can't randomly assign people to live near power lines for 20 years. So scientists observe and compare. It's messier.

buildup.text: Observational studies watch what happens naturally â€” no intervention. Types: cohort, case-control, and cross-sectional.

discovery.text: The smoking-cancer link was established through observational studies â€” an RCT would have been unethical.

twist.text: The flaw: confounding. People who eat organic food are also wealthier. Is the health benefit from food or money?

climax.text: Bradford Hill criteria help evaluate observational evidence: strength, consistency, temporality, dose-response.

punchline.text: When you can't experiment, observe carefully. Then check everything twice.

quiz.question: What is the main weakness of observational studies?
